intro: Phyteuma monocephalum, commonly known as the single-headed phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces a single, upright stem with clustered flowers, making it a striking addition to gardens. Phyteuma monocephalum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
